page.title: 14BYDEMILL FARM,HANNINGTON
page.content: Bydemill Farm is 900 years old and is still running well.Mr.Hussey-Freke owns Bydemill Farm and Copse,but Mr.Clint is farm manager.The farm has 25 fields which is about 360 acres.The fields are mainly grassland used for silage.Four fields are used for kale and corn and one other field is grazing land for cows.Eight cows get into the carousel in the milking parlour at a time.The suckers are put on the cows'teats and suck out all the milk into a marked jar.The farmer records the amount of milk.The suckers then come off automatically.Then the farmer sprays the teats.The cows then leave and another eight come in.Joined on to the farm house there is a watermill which is driven by Bydemill Brook,a tributary of the Thames.
